class HeapVector

Detailed Description

MemoryConfiguration

please refer to the APOXI MemoryManagement document for configuration.

DEFINES

APOXI_HEAP_MEM_POOL_TRACE: enables collecting information of memory pages and allow tracing out a visual view of all memory pages on the trace interface.

APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ALLOC_TRACE: enables trace output of each allocate and free call, shall be used only under Win32 because very much trace output is done.

APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE: enables collecting information of allocation per application/thread and allow tracing out a memory consumption per application and also per page/application related information. if this define is set also APOXI_HEAP_MEM_POOL_TRACE will be set automatically because also this information will be needed.

APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ACCESS_CHECK: enables checking wrong frees (double called) and memory overwrites. This define is set automatically under Win32.

APOXI_HEAP_MEM_DETECT_CONFIG: enables counting of memory usage and detecting of a memory configuration. This define is set automatically under Win32.

APOXI_HEAP_LENGTH_VECTOR (shall not be set manually): adds a length vector per page which contains the real length of the object which is allocated, this is necessary for overwrite checks and additional statistics. Take into account that additional memory is used to held length information.

APOXI_HEAP_CONTEXT_USAGE (shall not be set manually): adds a context vector per page which contains a context id of the object which is allocated, this is necessary for identification to which context an object belongs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

APOXI_HEAP_NAME_USAGE (shall not be set manually): adds a character array per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.

APOXI_HEAP_STATS_USAGE (shall not be set manually): adds a statistics structure per page which will be used for certain debug outputs. Take into account that additional memory is used to held this context information.
